title: How to Work out the Critical Angle of a Substance

steps.headline: Make sure you know the Snell's Law.
steps.description: The general form of Snell's Law is nxsinθx=nvacuumsinθvacuum, where n is the refractive index and θ is the angle of incidence or refraction.

steps.headline: Find out the refractive index of the substance (or nx).
You can now do the substitution.

sentences: Make sure you know the Snell's Law.
The general form of Snell's Law is nxsinθx=nvacuumsinθvacuum, where n is the refractive index and θ is the angle of incidence or refraction.
Find out the refractive index of the substance (or nx).
You can now do the substitution.
Let's say you are using glass with a refractive index of 1.50.
Therefore, the critical angle is the angle which, when it is the angle of incidence, produces an emergent ray of 90°.
